name: Magic Blueprint
description: Based on the book Magic System Blueprint by C.R. Rowenson

attributes.name: Name
attributes.description: A term or label to reference the magic itself (e.g. Dark or Light Magic)

attributes.name: Type of Magic
attributes.description: Is the magic well understood or mysterious? Are its effects predictable or unpredictable?

attributes.name: Effects and Abilities
attributes.description: Describe the special effects and abilities the magic produces

attributes.name: Limitations and Boundaries
attributes.description: Describe any limitations, costs, consequences, or countermeasures that exist relating to the magic

attributes.name: Source
attributes.description: Describe where the magic comes from, how much is present, and whether it can run out

attributes.name: Transference
attributes.description: The degree to which the magic can be acquired, lost, or transferred to others (e.g. high or low)

attributes.name: Prevalence
attributes.description: The degree to which the magic is widespread and commonplace (e.g. high or low)

attributes.name: Naturalness
attributes.description: The degree to which the magic seems "natural" or "normal" for the setting (e.g. high or low)

attributes.name: Ease of Use
attributes.description: The degree to which the magic can be used safely and effectively (e.g. high or low)

attributes.name: Reliability
attributes.description: The degree to which the magic consistently produces the expected results (e.g. high or low)

attributes.name: Balance
attributes.description: Does the magic create power disparities in the world or between characters?

attributes.name: Perception
attributes.description: How is the magic viewed by others? Is it good or evil? Is it desirable?

attributes.name: Consistency
attributes.description: The degree to which the magic is consistent with the rest of the magic system (e.g. high or low)
